Authors: Fang Wu, Xiang Hua Wang, Zuo Hong Chen
Title:
Five new species and one new record of Lactarius
(Russulaceae, Russulales) from central-southern China
Keywords:
ectomycorrhizal fungi, fagaceous forests, subtropical,
taxonomy, tropical
Abstract:
Five new species are described and one species new to
China is recorded from central and southern China, based on
morphological comparisons and analyses on ITS nrDNA sequences. The new
species Lactarius cheilocystidiatus and L. polycystis are distinctive in
L. subg. Plinthogalus due to the presence of real macrocystidia. They
are closely related to Thai L. crassiusculus. Lactarius gloeocarpus and
L. fagacicola are new members of L. subg. Lactarius, characterized by
the yellowish sticky pileus, reticulate spores and big macrocystidia.
They form a species complex with Chinese L. pallido-ochraceus and L.
pallidizonatus and Indian L. thindii. Lactarius hunanensis is a species
with strong temperate affinity. It is distinguished by the pileipellis
an ixolattice with olivaceous incrustations and spores with zebroid
ornamentation. Lactarius austroscrobiculatus, a tropical species
originally described from Indonesia, is reported from China for the
first time. Specimens studied are collected from Hunan, Anhui, Henan,
Jiangxi and Yunnan. Species reported in this study are representative
fungi in the Sino-Japan forest subkingdom.
